page.title: 16LLANGURIG, MEDIA
page.content: The only literature about the locality is part of the Montgomery Transactions, and a book about the parish written in the 19th century. Television reception is varied, but generally poor and non-existent to some. There is no relay mast. Radio reception is poor in the summer and suffers from continental interference. A very small number of people rent a video. Cassettes are available from a travelling shop, the local shop and Llanidloes. The County Times Gazette is the most widely read local paper. Some comics regularly read by children include Look In, The Eagle, Twinkle, Girl, Horse and Pony, Susie, Bunty, and Electron User.
